text: Harry George Thomas Groves (1918-1997) was a male boxer who competed for England. ==Boxing career== Groves represented England and won a gold medal in the 60 kg division at the 1938 British Empire Games in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia. ==Personal life== He was a brewers drayman by trade and lived in Condell Road, Battersea during 1938. ==References== Category:1918 births Category:1997 deaths Category:English male boxers Category:Boxers at the 1938 British Empire Games Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in boxing Category:Commonwealth Games gold medallists for England Category:Lightweight boxers
title: Harry Groves
